feed.title: Current Watches, Warnings and Advisories for the United States Issued by the National Weather Service

entry.title: Special Weather Statement issued September 12 at 6:44PM AKDT by NWS
entry.summary: ...Frost Possible Tonight... Frost is possible tonight across the Eastern Interior, including Fairbanks. Clear skies this evening will allow temperatures to fall rapidly after sunset, with temperature dropping into the 30s after midnight. Frost will be most likely in low lying areas. Clouds moving north over the area on Wednesday morning will cause

entry.title: Special Weather Statement issued September 13 at 3:23AM CDT by NWS
entry.summary: ...BE PREPARED FOR AREAS OF FOG IF TRAVELING THIS MORNING... Areas of fog have developed across portions of the region early this morning. Visibility has been variable, but at times down to one-quarter of a mile in locally dense fog. If traveling, prepare for rapid changes in visibility. entry.summary: ...PATCHY DENSE FOG THROUGH SUNRISE... Areas of fog have developed across North Central Indiana and the Wabash River Valley early this morning. entry.title: Special Weather Statement issued September 13 at 3:39AM EDT by NWS
entry.summary: ...Areas of Dense Fog This Morning... Areas of dense fog will affect the morning commute. Be alert for rapid changes in visibility in short distances, to below a quarter mile or less in some spots. Slow down, use low beam headlights, and leave plenty of distance between your vehicle and the one ahead of you when encountering areas of fog.

entry.title: Special Weather Statement issued September 13 at 2:50AM EDT by NWS
entry.summary: ...Areas of Dense Fog Developing Early This Morning... Areas of dense fog, especially near rivers and lakes, are developing and will affect many locations early this morning. Visibilities under one quarter mile are expected at some locations. Be alert for for rapid changes in visibility over short distances.

entry.title: Flash Flood Warning issued September 13 at 4:45AM EDT until September 13 at 6:00AM EDT by NWS
entry.summary: ...FLASH FLOOD WARNING REMAINS IN EFFECT UNTIL 6 AM EDT EARLY THIS MORNING FOR WICOMICO COUNTY... At 445 AM EDT, Doppler radar indicated that thunderstorms produced heavy rain across the warned area between 3 and 4 AM. Between 1.5 and 2.5 inches of rain have fallen. Remain alert for flash flooding within the warned area.

entry.title: Beach Hazards Statement issued September 13 at 4:27AM EDT until September 13 at 8:00PM EDT by NWS

entry.title: Coastal Flood Advisory issued September 13 at 3:41AM EDT until September 13 at 7:00AM EDT by NWS
entry.summary: ...COASTAL FLOOD ADVISORY IN EFFECT UNTIL 7 AM EDT THIS MORNING... * WHAT...Up to of one foot of inundation above ground level in low lying areas due to tidal flooding. * WHERE...Shoreline in Anne Arundel County. * WHEN...Until 7 AM EDT this morning, especially around the time of high tide.

entry.title: Special Weather Statement issued September 13 at 4:40AM EDT by NWS
entry.summary: ...LOCALLY DENSE FOG THIS MORNING... Areas of dense fog can be expected through this morning along the coast and into the I-95 corridor. Visibility will drop to a quarter mile or less at time with hazardous driving conditions. Areas most likely to experience dense fog are communities along the coast, and around hilltops over the interior.

entry.summary: ...LOCALLY DENSE FOG THIS MORNING... Areas of dense fog can be expected through this morning along the coast and into the I-95 corridor. Visibility will drop to a quarter mile or less at time with hazardous driving conditions. Areas most likely to experience dense fog are communities along the coast, and around hilltops over the interior.

entry.title: Special Weather Statement issued September 13 at 4:14AM CDT by NWS
entry.summary: ...HEAT INDEX VALUES BETWEEN 105 AND 109 DEGREES ARE EXPECTED TODAY... The combination of expected air and dewpoint temperatures will result in maximum Heat Index values between 105 and 109 degrees inclusive today.
